result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Briana Krueger

defendant.name: Krueger, Briana
defendant.address: 3702 Goodland Dr., c/o Nicole Coby, Madison, WI 53704

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF191, #14CF255, #14CF281 called at 11:34am. 
Defendant Briana  Krueger in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
-----------------------
In Case #14CF281:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Ms. Krueger waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.
Service of Information admitted, reading waived.
-------------------------

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewd; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Count #2 of Case #14CF191 and on Count #1 of Case #14CF281; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Ms. Krueger guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #14CF255.

On both Count #2 of Case #14CF191 and on Count #1 of Case #14CF281 the Court withholds sentence, and places Ms. Krueger on Probation for three years, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with all recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no direct or indirect contact with Kendall Avery unless approved by the Agent
--no presence at Dave's Turf & Marine in Watertown WI 
--to maintain absolute sobriety from both alcohol and all non-prescribed controlled substances
--to write a letter of apology to Leni Kahler (victim in #14CF281) within thirty days; to be submitted through the Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--in Case #14CF281: to pay restitution of $1887.78 to Dave's Turf & Marine
--in Case #14CF281: to pay the 10% restitution processing fee
--in Case #14CF281: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--in Case #14CF281: to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  1 day credit on case #14CF191 and on case #14CF281 each (this credit is from time served in read-in case #14CF255).
The Court will allow expungement of these cases if Ms. Krueger successfully completes the Probation terms. The Court clarifies that Ms. Krueger will need to file a petition for this after the Probation term is completed.
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given. 
Contact prohibition warnings/penalties given.
The Court finds that, if Probation is revoked, Ms. Krueger will be eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.

recess 12:05pm.
Stipulation and Order Cancelling current Court dates in above named files in favor of single later Plea & Sentencing Date
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 30, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Proposed STAO to Cancelling Current Court Dates in Favor of a Later Plea/Sentencing Date
Def. NOHs for the 8/27/14 DA PTC & the 9/16/14 STC for cases 14CF191 & 14CF255; Return to Sender; Not Deliverable as Addressed; Unable to Forward
Status conference on September 16, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 27, 2014 at 10:20 am.

[Clerk: MK]
cases #14CF191, #14CF255 called at 8:54am.
Defendant Briana Krueger in court with Attorney Samantha J. Humes.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
A new address is provided Ms. Krueger: c/o Nicole Coby, 3702 Goodland Drive, Madison WI 53704.
The Court raises concern that it observed Ms. Krueger earlier in the courtroom gallery and Ms. Krueger appeared to be trying to catch the attention of Kendall Avery (who was appearing in custody on other cases) .  The Court emphasizes to Ms. Krueger that she must follow the conditions of Bond including that contact with Kendall Avery is prohibited.  
As to both cases, Ms. Krueger waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
recess 8:58am. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/27/14 at 10:20am. (2) schedule both cases for Status Conference approximately 2-3 weeks after the Pretrial date
Defendant called at 8:17am. She is driving from Madison and running about 10 minutes late
Status conference on August 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 1:31pm. 
Defendant Briana Krueger appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties

A new address is provided for Ms. Krueger of:  1153 Boughton Street, #16-D, Watertown WI.

The Court requires a $1,500  signature bond, with conditions:
--no presence in any Piggly Wiggly Store
--no possession or consumption of any alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--not to discuss the facts of the case with her mother
--booking at JCSO before release from the Jail
recess 1:34pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference tomorrow at 10:20am (2) Status Conference on 8/11/14 at 8:30am. (JA-please note in comments that case is at Prelim stage)
